417,FUTURE,present continuous for future use,B2,3,USE: QUESTIONS ABOUT THE FUTURE,Can use the present continuous with a wide range of common verbs to ask about future plans.,"So are you planning to visit Japan then? (Japan
When is the festival starting and when is it finishing? (Czech Republic
What kind of seminar materials are you providing? (Switzerland
418,FUTURE,present simple for future use,A2,N/A,FORM: WITH 'WHEN',Can use the present simple with 'when' to refer to the future.,"I'll tell you more when I meet you. (Vietnam
Can you, please, call me when you find it? (Brazil
419,FUTURE,present simple for future use,A2,N/A,USE: 'HOPE',Can use the present simple with 'I hope' to talk about hopes and wishes for the future.,"I hope you enjoy your holiday too. (Malaysia
I hope you come to visit me soon. (Argentina

420,FUTURE,present simple for future use,A2,N/A,USE: TIMETABLES AND PLANS,Can use the present simple to talk about timetabled events in the future.,"[Talking about a film] It begins on 8 o'clock in the evening. (Switzerland
The class is on Monday.  It starts at 6:00 pm and finishes at 7:00 pm. (Cuba

421,FUTURE,present simple for future use,B1,N/A,FORM: WITH 'AS SOON AS',Can use the present simple with 'as soon as' to refer to the future.,"I'm planning to move as soon as I finish college because job opportunities in my area aren't good. (Brazil
I will let you know as soon as I get the exact date. (Colombia

422,FUTURE,present simple for future use,C1,N/A,FORM: WITH 'BY THE TIME',Can use the present simple with 'by the time' to refer to the future.," … by the time he gets home, he will just want to go straight to bed. (Mexico
By the time you arrive the information office at the airport will be closed, as at 11.00 o'clock a full day strike will start. (Italy

423,FUTURE,present simple for future use,C1,N/A,USE: SUGGESTIONS, OBLIGATION ",Can use the present simple after speech act verbs expressing suggestions and obligation.,"We would suggest that our management takes a closer look. (C1 German)
I recommend that we go to the theatre in Ginza where ""Miss Saigon"" is on. (Japan
Moreover, we insist that the agreement between you is legally binding …. (Russia

424,FUTURE,present simple for future use,C2,N/A,FORM: INVERSION WITH 'ONLY WHEN',Can use the present simple with 'only when' (followed by 'will' and inverted subject) to refer to the future.,"Only when we understand that, will we be able to live in better societies. (Argentina
Moreover, I think that only when people manage this will they be able to move on with their lives and offer something new to humanity. (Greece
And, sadly, I also believe that only when something really catastrophic happens will citizens face reality and accept that measures must be taken. (Portugal
425,MODALITY,adjectives,A2,N/A,FORM: 'BE' + 'SURE' + CLAUSE,Can use 'I' + 'be' + 'sure' + clause.,"I'm sure I can beat you at chess. (Malaysia
I am not sure what I want to do but I am sure we will find something to do. (Norway
I’m sure that you will love it. (Brazil
426,MODALITY,adjectives,B1,N/A,FORM: 'IT' + 'BE' + 'IMPORTANT' + CLAUSE,Can use 'it' + 'be' + 'important' + ('that') clause.,"It's important that you take breaks and don't work all the time. (Germany
It's important that you eat healthy food. (Mexico
I think it's important that you analyze each point to decide what to do. (Italy

427,MODALITY,adjectives,B1,N/A,"FORM/USE: 'IF'-CLAUSE + 'POSSIBLE', POLITENESS","Can use 'if-' clauses + 'possible', as a politeness strategy. ","If it is possible I would like to pay by credit card. (B1 THRESHOLD
If possible, please re-deliver the same goods right now. (China
I'm not free at 6 so I'd change it to 9 if it's possible. (Libya
If it's possible, could you send the cards to my office in London? (Sweden
I would prefer the 15th of July if it is possible. (Austria
The opening hours are quite convenient but, if possible, I would like the pool to open a bit earlier - at 8.30 am, for example. (Greece

428,MODALITY,adjectives,B1,N/A,"FORM/USE: 'IT' + 'BE' + ADJECTIVE + INFINITIVE, HEDGING, EMPHASIS","Can use 'it' + 'be' + adjective + 'to' + infinitive, to make an assertion more or less direct. ","Our sales department staff are heavily involved in several international projects, so it is necessary to improve their foreign language skills. (Germany
But sometimes it's essential to do what your parents want you to do. (Georgia (Republic of)
In the centre of town it is possible to do more activities after school. (Italy
[talking about a computer problem] It was impossible to install the system. (Ecuador

429,MODALITY,adjectives,B1,N/A,FORM: 'IT' + 'BE' + ADJECTIVE + 'FOR' + OBJECT + INFINITIVE,Can use 'it' + 'be' + adjective + 'for' + object + 'to' + infinitive.,"If you have to choose between two schools, I think it's important for you to know what they’re like. (Peru
It's impossible for me to meet with you at six o'clock. (Spain
It is important for everyone to attend this meeting. (Germany
[talking about not missing class] It's essential for me to go because I think I can't study physics by myself. (Iran

430,MODALITY,adjectives,B2,N/A,FORM: 'IT' + LINKING VERB + ADJECTIVES + CLAUSE,Can use 'it' + linking verb + adjective + ('that') clause.,"It seems clear to me that swimming is good for the whole body. (B2 VANTAGE
It is obvious that some people prefer reading books. (Poland
It is possible that we can be educated by TV. (Japan
It seems obvious that it is not necessary. (Switzerland

431,MODALITY,adjectives,B2,N/A,"FORM/USE: 'IT' + LINKING VERB + ADJECTIVES + CLAUSE, HEDGING",Can use 'it' + linking verb + adjective + ('that') clause to make an assertion less direct.,"It does not seem possible that we can live without any private life. (Japan
It is likely that by reading books we will learn some new words and phrases so that we will be able to write better. (Poland
It is possible that only one computer will do this. (Moldova (Republic of)

432,MODALITY,adjectives,B2,N/A,FORM: SUBJECT + 'BE' + ADJECTIVE + 'TO' + INFINITIVE,Can use pronoun or noun + 'be' + adjective + 'to' + (past) infinitive.,"They are unlikely to arrive on Friday. (India
We are sure to increase our turnover and at least our profit. (Austria
Whenever money is involved, some problems are likely to happen. (Spain
If you see a movie, it is likely to have been made with computers. (Switzerland

433,MODALITY,adjectives,B2,N/A,"FORM/USE: 'IT' + LINKING VERB + ADJECTIVES + ('THAT') CLAUSE, FOCUS",Can use 'it' + linking verb + adjective + ('that') clause as a focusing device.,"It is clear that we can't live without computers today. (Russia
It seems obvious that this oil comes from the gas station. (other
Computers became part of the human life style because they help us to make our lives easier, but it is clear that we should never depend on machines to handle our lives. (Mexico
Due to the introduction of a new staff appraisal form, it is crucial that you take part. (Switzerland
It's obvious you can't ride forty kilometres twice a day, unless you're very sporty. (France
It is essential that you know the advantages of our new product in order to sell this bag efficiently. (Germany

434,MODALITY,adjectives,C1,N/A,"FORM/USE: MODIFYING ADJECTIVES, HEDGING","Can modify adjectives with degree adverbs, often to make an assertion less direct.","If you want to come earlier or if there's a public transport strike (which is quite probable), you will have to take a taxi. (Poland
It is almost certain that we'll have fights in the future but we will probably overcome them. (Greece

435,MODALITY,adjectives,C1,N/A,"FORM/USE: MODIFYING ADJECTIVES, EMPHASIS","Can modify adjectives with adverbs, often for emphasis.","It is painfully obvious that it will rescue our city from the pollution and fumes that cars are producing. (Poland
[talking about stolen goods] It is highly unlikely that the goods can vanish from your warehouse without that being noticed. (Russia
436,MODALITY,can,A1,N/A,FORM: AFFIRMATIVE,Can use the affirmative form.,"You can see a lot of special places in Wroclaw. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH, 2007, Polish)
You can make a quick snack, for example, a sandwich. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH, 2006, German)"
437,MODALITY,can,A1,N/A,FORM: NEGATIVE,Can use the negative forms.,"I cannot come to see you. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH, 2009, Bengali)
I'm very nervous and I can't say anything. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH Polish)"
438,MODALITY,can,A1,N/A,FORM: QUESTION,Can use the affirmative question form.,"Can you come for dinner Monday at 6.00 pm? (Arabic - Other, A1 BREAKTHROUGH, Pass, 2008)
Can we go to the park on the Sunday? (Somali, A1 BREAKTHROUGH, Pass, 2011)"
439,MODALITY,can,A1,N/A,USE: ABILITY,Can use 'can' to talk about ability to do something.,"I can cook. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH, 2009, Turkish)
I can write English. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH, 2007, Thai)
[talking about someone with a physical disability] He cannot go up stairs. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH, 2009, Urdu)
[talking about reading in English] I can’t read very well. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH, 2007, Polish)"
440,MODALITY,can,A1,N/A,USE: OFFERS,Can use 'can' to make an offer.,"Can I help you? (A1 BREAKTHROUGH, 2009, Lithuanian)
What can I do for you? (A1 BREAKTHROUGH, 2009, Turkish)
How can I help you? (A1 BREAKTHROUGH, 2009, Polish)
If you want, I can come to your house and I can help you with for example some housework on Sunday this weekend. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH

441,MODALITY,can,A1,N/A,USE: POSSIBILITY,Can use 'can' to talk about possibility.,"The shop is next to the post office. There you can find milk, juices and sweets but you can't buy meat. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH, 2008, Spanish - Other)
I cannot see you today. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH, 2009, Farsi)
I'm sorry I can't see you now because I am very busy at work. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH, 2009, Mandarin)"
442,MODALITY,can,A1,N/A,USE: REQUESTS,Can use 'can' to make a request.,"Can you come on Sunday at seven o’clock? (A1 BREAKTHROUGH, 2010, Arabic)
Can you call me? (A1 BREAKTHROUGH, 2009, Lithuanian)"
443,MODALITY,can,A2,N/A,USE: PERMISSION,Can use 'can' to give and refuse permission or talk about what is forbidden.,"You can wear anything you want. (A2 WAYSTAGE, 2008, Spanish - Latin American)
You can’t bring your mobile phone. (A2 WAYSTAGE, 2006, Spanish - European)
You cannot wear jeans or flip-flops. (A2 WAYSTAGE, 2008, Portuguese)"
444,MODALITY,can,B1,N/A,FORM: NEGATIVE QUESTIONS,Can use the negative question forms in main clauses and question tags.,"Can't you go with your parents some time and with your friends later? (Spain
Why can't she visit them alone and I can relax at the beach? (Germany
You can ask your parents what they think you should do, can't you? (Brazil

445,MODALITY,can,B1,1,FORM: WITH ADVERBS,"Can use 'can' with a limited range of adverbs (including 'also', 'always', 'even', 'just', 'only', 'really', 'still') in the normal mid position after the modal verb.   ► adverbs","You can also write postcards and letters to your friends. (B1 THRESHOLD, 2008, German)
I can only tell you what I think about it, because you have to decide. (B1 THRESHOLD, 2008, Italian)
I can't even remember the girl's face. (B1 THRESHOLD, 2006, Vietnamese)
The trouble is that I can't really afford it. (B1 THRESHOLD, 2001, French)"

446,MODALITY,can,B1,N/A,USE: GENERAL TRUTHS AND TENDENCIES,Can use 'can be' to talk about general truths and tendencies.,"… spending an entire summer without your friends can be very boring. (B1 THRESHOLD, 2008,  Spanish - European)
Sitting all day long in front of a computer can be very stressful. (Portuguese, B1 THRESHOLD, Pass, 2009)
The centre of town can be more dangerous and noisy. (B1 THRESHOLD, 2008, Portuguese)"
447,MODALITY,can,B1,N/A,USE: SURPRISE,Can use 'can you believe' to express surprise.,"They invented a robot which plays football, can you believe this? (B1 THRESHOLD, 2008, Portuguese)
It cost me £50! Can you believe that! It was expensive but worth it! (B1 THRESHOLD, 2009, Tagalog)"

448,MODALITY,can,B2,2,FORM: WITH ADVERBS,"Can use 'can' with an increasing range of adverbs (including 'easily', 'hardly', 'now', 'probably', 'sometimes', 'still') in the normal mid position after the modal verb or after the subject in questions.  ► adverbs","In case you need them , I can easily provide references. (Brazil
On the other hand you can hardly imagine an evening when you are sitting in your armchair, the tea is on the table and you are reading your favourite novel on a computer screen. (Czech Republic
As you read her book, you can probably imagine what kind of personality she has got, and after finishing it, you will be more cheerful than before. (Japan

449,MODALITY,can,B2,N/A,USE: GENERAL TRUTHS AND TENDENCIES,Can use 'can' to talk about general truths and tendencies.,"…some young people can feel bored when they have to walk a lot and look at […] very old things. (Polish, B2 VANTAGE, Pass, 1999)
Too much work can cause ""stress"" and heart problems. (Portuguese, B2 VANTAGE, Pass, 1993)"
450,MODALITY,can,B2,N/A,USE: GUESSES AND PREDICTIONS,"Can use the negative forms of 'can't' and 'cannot' to guess, predict and deduce.","You look very pale and you can’t be feeling well. (Poland
I think that it can’t be true. (Uruguay
[talking about someone suspected of being a criminal] He can't be
It cannot be any good for these animals to be taken away from their natural surroundings. (Sweden
451,MODALITY,can,B2,N/A,USE: REPROACHES AND APPEALS,Can use negative forms of 'can' to make reproaches or appeals.,"You can’t forget your friends. (Brazil
…he can't go on behaving like this. (Italy
Please, listen, you can't go on studying so hard. (Spain
You have to realise that you cannot work all the time: your body needs some rest. (B2 VANTAGE
Can't you see how exhausted you are? (France

452,MODALITY,can,C1,N/A,"FORM/USE: PAST NEGATIVE, DEDUCTIONS",Can use 'can't' or 'cannot have' + '-ed' to make deductions.,"I live with my partner and we can't have used so much electricity. (C1 EFFECTIVE OPERATIONAL PROFICIENCY
…it cannot have been such a disappointment. (Swedish, C1 EFFECTIVE OPERATIONAL PROFICIENCY, Pass, 2000)
The air-conditioning cannot have been working properly as the coach was too cold. (Danish, C1 EFFECTIVE OPERATIONAL PROFICIENCY, Pass, 1998)"

453,MODALITY,can,C1,N/A,FORM: PASSIVE,"Can use 'can' in passive reporting clauses in a more formal impersonal style (e.g. for reports and academic contexts), such as 'It can be said that', 'It can be argued (that)', 'It can be concluded that', 'It can be considered'.► passives","It can be argued, looking at the figures, that the company should consider withdrawing from the heater market. (Spain
Taking everything into account, it can be concluded that the current training course is very useful for our company. (Russia
As for marriage and relationships, it can be said that women who have a job, nowadays, do not quit it after marriage. (Brazil

454,MODALITY,can,C1,3,FORM: WITH ADVERBS,Can use a wide range of adverbs with 'can' in the normal mid position after the modal verb). ► adverbs,"Only those who live with their relatives can fully understand how essential is the role of your parents, sisters, aunts... (Yugoslavia
Miss Sylvia Ann Powers is a good friend of mine for over six years, so I can honestly say that I know her personality fairly well. (Poland

455,MODALITY,can,C1,N/A,USE: EMPHASIS,"Can use expressions with 'can' or 'can’t' to give focus or add emphasis, such as 'as you can see', 'I can't say', 'I can tell you that', 'as you can imagine', 'I can say that', 'I can assure you that'. ","So, as you can see, there are no serious consequences for us, so far. (C1 EFFECTIVE OPERATIONAL PROFICIENCY
I can't say I was very impressed with the level and the way the classes were given. (Spain
About my country, I can tell you that we went through a great number of wars in the last century… (Argentina

456,MODALITY,can,C2,N/A,USE: REFLECTIONS,"Can use 'how can' to reflect, through rhetorical questions. ","And how can we improve if we are not allowed to make mistakes, evaluate our experiences in a new light and try again? (Netherlands
But how can each of us stay fit in this world of stress and fast food restaurants? (Greek, C2 MASTERY, Pass, 2005)"
457,MODALITY,dare,B2,N/A,FORM: AFFIRMATIVE,Can use affirmative form dare + infinitive without to.,I can cook if you dare eat it! (Taiwan

458,MODALITY,dare,B2,N/A,FORM: NEGATIVE,Can use negative form dare not and daren't +  infinitive without to.,"[talking about a restaurant] But many local people dare not go to Lily, because it is too expensive. (Taiwan

459,MODALITY,dare,B2,N/A,USE: BRAVADO,Can use semi-modal 'dare' to talk about being brave enough to do something.,"Some people object that I have to put up with the rain and other inconveniences, but I think that they are rather jealous because they daren't give up their car. (France

460,MODALITY,dare,C1,N/A,FORM/USE: 'I DARE SAY',Can use the fixed expression 'I dare say' to say that something is probably true.,"I feel that I have a huge responsibility trying to choose only one option, but I dare say that the last option may be the best one. (Argentina
I must express my concern about some facilities, like the student study centre and the canteen, which I dare say needs improvement. (Italy
461,MODALITY,dare,C1,N/A,FORM: QUESTION,Can use the question form.,Dare we run the risk of even one child or adult turning to violent crime because they think it is ok? (Greece
462,MODALITY,dare,C1,N/A,USE: 'HOW DARE …!',Can use 'how dare … !' to express disapproval or offense about something,"How dare people say that we don't practice sport! (Spain
… how dare you say that this event was a complete failure! (France

463,MODALITY,dare,C2,N/A,FORM/USE: NEGATIVE WITH 'DIDN'T',Can use the negative form 'didn't dare' + infinitive without 'to' to talk about not being brave enough to do something.,"She didn't dare think about him and the possibility that he would never come back. (Sweden
Since we didn't dare move our feet, we were slowly swaying to the left and to the right, backwards and forwards. (Turkey
464,MODALITY,expressions with be,A2,N/A,FORM/USE: 'WILL BE ABLE TO',Can use 'will' + 'be able to' + infinitive to talk about possibility and ability.,"Will you be able to come this time? (Brazil
[talking about contact lenses] Without them I will not be able to play football. (Spain
If you need a musical instrument, I can bring my guitar but unfortunately I won't be able to play it because I have never learned it. (France

465,MODALITY,expressions with be,B1,N/A,FORM: MODAL WITH 'BE ABLE TO',Can use a range of modal verbs + 'be able to' + infinitive.,"After finishing school, you might be able to hang out with your friends. (Mexico
If we could meet in Switzerland, we should be able to finish the project on the 20th June. (Switzerland
I'd be able to take walks without even worrying about inhaling polluted air. (Malaysia

466,MODALITY,expressions with be,B1,1,FORM: 'BE' EXPRESSIONS,"Can use a limited range of expressions with 'be' + infinitive ('be allowed to', 'be supposed to', 'be able to') with present and past forms of 'be' and with modal 'will'. ","First of all, if you are allowed to go out of the building in your break, you should do it. (Cyprus
Perhaps you will be allowed to go on holiday with your friends next year. (Germany
The film is supposed to start at 7.00 pm so we'd better meet at 6.30 pm. See you there! (Brazil
I was supposed to be meeting my friend Laura but she didn't come. (France
I am sorry but I  am not able to meet you next Tuesday. (Germany
We were able to choose the songs ourselves and so I liked them very much. (Germany

467,MODALITY,expressions with be,B1,N/A,"USE: 'BE ALLOWED TO', PERMISSION",Can use 'be allowed to' to talk about permission.,"My mother went with me on this trip because I wasn't allowed to go by myself. (Uruguay
You won't be allowed to do what you want and you won't enjoy yourself. (Italy

468,MODALITY,expressions with be,B1,N/A,"USE: 'BE SUPPOSED TO', PAST EXPECTATION","Can use 'was supposed to', 'were supposed to' to refer to past or future arrangements which may not have happened or may change. ","I am really sorry, but I will have to make some changes to my trip. I was supposed to arrive on 11th June 2003, but I will arrive the next month. (Mexico
It was supposed to be on Tuesday at 1.00pm. (Brazil
We were supposed to meet at noon with some friends, but they called her to ask if we could meet at the restaurant. (Mexico

469,MODALITY,expressions with be,B1,N/A,"USE: 'BE ABLE TO', PAST","Can use 'was able to', 'were able to' to talk about facts in the past.","[about a bus journey] She was able to get a good seat and she unexpectedly got to school early. (Philippines
… sales had increased recently because of the good performance of our staff so we were able to improve the quality of our products ... (Ecuador

470,MODALITY,expressions with be,B2,3,FORM: 'BE' EXPRESSIONS + INFINITIVE,"Can use the full range of expressions with 'be' + infinitive ('be likely to', 'be due to', 'be meant to', 'be bound to', 'be sure to', 'be certain to', 'be obliged to') with present and past forms of 'be' and with modal 'will' .","People who read books are likely to be more knowledgeable. (Argentina
I'm bound to feel nervous. (France
According to our new marketing strategy, we are sure to increase our turnover and our profit. (Austria
[talking about a new job] I am due to start on Monday 4 June. (Georgia (Republic of)
I would like to inform you that as of 1st of June all operational staff will be obliged to use identity cards. (Poland
Sleepy and unwilling to take part of the conference, I was obliged to spend the evening listening to the soft voice of a man who was famous for his boring performances. (Italy

471,MODALITY,expressions with be,B2,N/A,FORM: 'BE' + ADJECTIVE + 'THAT',Can use 'be' + 'obvious/sure/likely/certain' followed by a 'that'-clause.,"It is about 1000 years old, so I am sure that you will find it fascinating to see it. (Japan
It was obvious that I would be late to work. (Greece
It is likely that by reading books we will learn some new words and phrases so that we will be able to write better. (Poland
It is certain that our state-of-the-art LCD will be well received and make great profits. (China

472,MODALITY,expressions with be,B2,N/A,"FORM/USE: 'BE MORE/LESS LIKELY', COMPARISON",Can use '(much) more/less' to modify 'likely' in a comparison.,"In case of an accident, one is more likely to be badly injured when riding a bicycle. (Poland

Since they are more and better educated when they leave school at 18 years old, their minds are more mature and they are more sensible. They are more likely to have better jobs and a better life, and much less likely to cause problems to other people. (B2 VANTAGE

473,MODALITY,expressions with be,B2,N/A,"USE: 'BE LIKELY TO', PROBABILITY",Can use 'be' (+modifier) 'likely to' to talk about probability.,"And whenever money is involved, some problems are likely to happen. (Spain
I am very likely to make mistakes which I would like to avoid. (Poland

474,MODALITY,expressions with be,B2,N/A,"USE: 'BE DUE TO', 'BE TO', SCHEDULES","Can use 'be due to' and, more formally, 'be to' to talk about things that are scheduled or expected. ","I have attached the … company law directive enacted 2 years ago and which is due to be implemented by 2008. (Austria
The programme was due to start at midday. (Argentina
I am sorry that I cannot attend the meeting at head office as expected, as I am to go on a business trip to New York then. (China
I was to take exams in two weeks and had to study hard. (Greece

475,MODALITY,expressions with be,B2,N/A,"USE: 'BE MEANT TO', IDEAL STATES",Can use 'be meant to' to talk about ideal states.,"Animals are meant to be free, and man should be very careful about interfering with nature. (Swedish, B2 VANTAGE, Pass, 1993)
Primary school is meant to be there so that you build all the basics of your education. (French, B2 VANTAGE, ===NONE===, 2011)"

476,MODALITY,expressions with be,B2,N/A,"USE: 'BE SUPPOSED TO', OBLIGATION, EXPECTATION",Can use 'be supposed to' to talk about expectation or obligation.,"However, the show is only on the 14th of March, the same day we are supposed to go to a Science Museum. (Brazil
Our travels are supposed to provide us with pleasure, knowledge and new experiences. (B2 VANTAGE
I have bought some disks but I don't know what I am supposed to do with them. (Spain
I was supposed to explain to them what they had to do. (Poland

477,MODALITY,expressions with be,B2,N/A,USE: 'BE SUPPOSED TO', HEARSAY",Can use 'be supposed to' to talk about hearsay or supposition.,"That woman is supposed to have killed her husbands (at least two), because she wanted their money. (Spain
The lake is supposed to be very beautiful. (Sweden

478,MODALITY,expressions with be,B2,N/A,"USE: 'BE BOUND TO', CERTAINTY",Can use 'be' (+ modifier) 'bound to' to talk about something certain or inevitable.,"I assure you that it is bound to be popular with different clients, especially young people and white-collar workers. (China
It is hardly possible to catch a cold when travelling by car in rain which is almost bound to happen while riding a bicycle. (Poland
To sum up, where many people get together, problems are bound to arise. (Denmark

479,MODALITY,expressions with be,B2,N/A,FORM/USE: IMPERATIVE,"Can use the imperative form 'be sure to', to express obligation. ","If you cannot attend, be sure to inform me in advance. (Chinese, B2 VANTAGE, Pass, 2008)
Be sure to contact me for any further information. (Russia

480,MODALITY,expressions with be,B2,N/A,USE: 'BE SURE/CERTAIN TO',"Can use 'be sure to', 'be certain to' to talk about certainty. ","A person that will act in that way is sure to be successful. (Greece
Furthermore, by bicycle, you don't spend your time in traffic-jams and you are sure to arrive at work on time. (France
The market for this product is not yet fully developed, but we are certain to attract more and more people, especially students. (China

481,MODALITY,expressions with be,B2,N/A,"USE: 'BE OBLIGED TO', OBLIGATION","Can use 'be obliged to' to talk about an external obligation, especially in institutional contexts. ","The Sales Representatives are obliged to participate. (Switzerland
By January 2 everybody is obliged to have a parking permit when using the company car park. (German, B2 VANTAGE, Pass, 2001)
They were obliged to give up their house. (France

482,MODALITY,expressions with be,B2,N/A,"USE: 'BE FORCED TO', OBLIGATION","Can use 'be forced to' to talk about an unnamed obligation, where the circumstances are beyond the control of the speaker/writer. ","I don't like to be forced to do something that I don't want to do. (Poland
Due to decreasing sales over the last months, we are forced to cut the budget. (German, B2 VANTAGE, Pass, 2006)"

483,MODALITY,expressions with be,C1,N/A,"USE: 'BE SET TO', ASSERTION","Can use 'be set to' to talk about strong assertion about the future, especially in institutional contexts. ","The turnover of our company is set to increase dramatically after the establishment of the e-shop, which itself requires little investment. (China
The population of children is set to plummet to 11.5% and that of working people also to 46.2% in 2050. (Netherlands

(Portugal

511,MODALITY,may,C2,N/A,FORM/USE: 'MAY AS WELL',"Can use 'may as well' to talk about what we think is the easiest or most logical course of action, often when we cannot see a better alternative or when it will not spoil the situation if you do that thing. ► might","A few minutes later, she began hesitantly: ""After all, you may as well know…” (France

","On balance, it may be concluded that although international sports competitions do involve such factors as serious and physical strain and commercial gain, their ultimate aim remains unchanged - namely, to find out in a fair way who deserves the title of the winner. (Russia

553,MODALITY,need,C1,N/A,"FORM: PAST, NEGATIVE",Can use 'needn't have' + '-ed'.,"You needn't have bought me anything! (Spain

554,MODALITY,need,C2,N/A,FORM: QUESTIONS,Can use the question form.,"Need you ask? (Greece
Lastly I would appreciate , as I am sure others would too, if the premises were cleaner. Need I say more? (India
555,MODALITY,need,C2,N/A,USE: IN DISCUSSION,Can use the question form rhetorically in discussion, typically in formal contexts.","Need I go on? (Cyprus
Need you work in this way? (Spain
556,MODALITY,ought,B1,N/A,FORM: AFFIRMATIVE,Can use the affirmative form.,"I think you ought to go on holiday with both of them. (Turkey
Oh, I'm sorry, my mum's calling and I ought to go. (Argentina

557,MODALITY,ought,B1,N/A,USE: ADVICE,Can use 'ought to' with 'you' to give advice.,"Then, if you'd rather go with your friend, you ought to talk to your parents first, and tell them what you think about it. (France
I think that you ought to play tennis or football at the weekend. (Switzerland

558,MODALITY,ought,B2,N/A,FORM: ELLIPSIS,Can use 'ought to' without a following verb where the previous main verb is understood. ► ellipsis,Otherwise some students would not get as much specialised help as they ought to. (Germany

559,MODALITY,ought,B2,N/A,USE: DESIRED STATES,Can use 'ought to' to talk about desired states of affairs.,"Furthermore, we ought to take care of our health by going on trips to not unpolluted places as often as possible. (France

Of course not all zoos are as good as they ought to be, but today we know so much about the different animals that they don't have to get bored in the zoo and we're able to provide them with the environment they prefer. (Denmark
There shouldn't be any rubbish dumps, all the rubbish ought to be recycled. (Brazil

560,MODALITY,ought,C1,N/A,"FORM/USE: DESIRED STATES, WITH 'THERE OUGHT TO BE' ",Can use 'there ought to be' to talk about desired states of affairs.,"The rooms were dirty, there was no room service and there ought to be a lift since the rooms were on the 4th floor. (Sweden
… we came to the conclusion that there ought to be some changes to the club’s publicity. (Portugal
I think there ought to be more excursions and guided tours. (Sweden

561,MODALITY,ought,C1,N/A,"FORM/USE: EMPHASIS, WITH 'REALLY'",Can use 'ought to' with 'really' to add emphasis.,"Moreover, you really ought to ask for details about the timetable they've set for schooling hours, just to be sure that its fits the with way of studying you are accustomed to. (Greece
This is what almost everyone thinks, but we really ought to think a little bit more about it. (Spain
One really ought to know the interests, wishes and demands of the receiver. (Slovakia

562,MODALITY,ought,C1,N/A,"FORM/USE: PAST, AFFIRMATIVE",Can use 'ought to have' + '-ed' to refer to desired states of affairs in the past.,"Another point, which I think ought to have been better managed, was the boat trip on the Thames. (Poland
However, the expert that I have consulted claims that this kind of polluted water is the most common consequence when placing gas stations and the government ought to have known that. (Sweden
We were taken by surprise, when we didn’t get a tour guide. We ought to have booked one! (Greece

563,MODALITY,ought,C1,N/A,USE: LIKELIHOOD,Can use 'ought to' to talk about something which is likely.,"… the fundamental function of accounting software is to record the numerous ordinary business activities, which may improve the efficiency of the company. Besides, it ought to provide useful information in decision-making. (China
You ought not to be hungry. (Turkey

564,MODALITY,ought,C2,N/A,"FORM: CONTRACTED FORM, NEGATIVE",Can use 'oughtn't' (without 'to') + verb.,…they will most certainly have a banquet that day... and you oughtn't miss it for the world! (Portugal
565,MODALITY,ought,C2,N/A,FORM: NEGATIVE,Can use the negative form 'ought not to'.,"Secondly, there ought not to be a division between rich and poor. (Netherlands
We ought not to forget that in the last twenty years the food industry has increased the number of chemicals used in its products. (Uruguay

566,MODALITY,ought,C2,N/A,"FORM: QUESTIONS, NEGATIVE ","Can use 'ought' + subject + 'not to' + verb to form (rhetorical) questions, often in formal contexts. ","And if not, ought we not to learn from the mistakes of the past? (Denmark
567,MODALITY,shall,A2,N/A,FORM: AFFIRMATIVE,Can use the affirmative form.,"We shall start tomorrow at 2 o'clock. (Marathi, A2 WAYSTAGE, Pass, 2006)
I shall be free on Sunday at 6 o'clock in the evening. (Ukraine
568,MODALITY,shall,A2,N/A,FORM: QUESTIONS,Can use the question form.,"Shall we meet at half past 4 in front of my house? (Japanese, A2 WAYSTAGE, Pass, 2008)

569,MODALITY,shall,A2,N/A,USE: OFFERS,Can use 'shall I' to make offers.,"Shall I go and buy some cake and crackers? (Bulgarian, A2 WAYSTAGE, Pass, 2009)

570,MODALITY,shall,A2,N/A,USE: SUGGESTIONS,Can use 'shall' with 'we' to make suggestions.,"Tomorrow evening there is Laura Pausini's concert in Turin. Shall we go? (Italian, A2 WAYSTAGE, Pass, 2010)
Shall we go to a Korean restaurant after the film? (Korean, A2 WAYSTAGE, Pass, 2003)"

571,MODALITY,shall,B1,N/A,USE: PLANS AND INTENTIONS,"Can use 'shall' to talk about plans and intentions, particularly in formal contexts.","I promise that I shall cover all the work and give it to you tomorrow. (Thai, B1 THRESHOLD, Pass, 2006)
Remember that we shall meet inside the bar. (Russian, B1 THRESHOLD, Pass, 2008)

[a student writing to a teacher] I am really sorry but I have to travel to Argentina for health reasons. What shall I do with next week's work? (Spanish - Latin American, B1 THRESHOLD, Pass, 2009)
573,MODALITY,shall,C1,N/A,FORM: NEGATIVE,Can use the negative form.,This way, students shall not die of boredom or feel that their stay was useless. (Japan

574,MODALITY,shall,C1,N/A,USE: COMMANDS AND INSTRUCTIONS,Can use 'shall' to express commands in very formal contexts.,"We therefore need to insist that the agreement is binding and that the contract shall be fulfilled. (Swiss German, C1 EFFECTIVE OPERATIONAL PROFICIENCY, Pass, 2007)"

575,MODALITY,shall,C2,N/A,USE: AFTER 'IF' CLAUSES,Can use 'shall' in the main clause after an 'if-' clause  ► conditionals,"Nowadays people live longer than they did in the past, which is very nice and pleasant, but we must be careful because if things get out of hand, … we shall be doomed to live in complete chaos. (Portuguese, C2 MASTERY, Pass, 1993)

… we shall probably have several years more to live. (France

580,MODALITY,should,A2,N/A,USE: ADVICE,Can use 'should' to give advice.,"It was only €70. It is pink. It looks very nice. My advice, you should buy this. (Turkish, A2 WAYSTAGE, Pass, 2007)

581,MODALITY,should,A2,N/A,USE: SUGGESTIONS,Can use 'should' to make suggestions.,"I think we should meet at 2 pm, and my mother will take us there so don't worry. (Spanish - Latin American, A2 WAYSTAGE, Pass, 2008)

582,MODALITY,should,B1,N/A,FORM/USE: QUESTION TAGS,Can use the question tag form 'shouldn't' + pronoun to make suggestions and ask for opinions.,"When you come back, we should rent some movies, shouldn't we? (Argentina

585,MODALITY,should,B1,N/A,USE: IDEAL OR DESIRED SITUATIONS,Can use 'should' to talk about ideal or desired situations.,"British people should eat more vegetables and fruit and avoid fast food! (Italian, B1 THRESHOLD, Pass, 2010)

587,MODALITY,should,B1,N/A,USE: NARRATIVE DEVICE,Can use 'you should have' + '-ed' to emphasise points in a story.,"You should have heard the noise. (Spanish - Latin American, B1 THRESHOLD, Pass, 2002)

588,MODALITY,should,B1,N/A,USE: REGRET,Can use 'should have' + '-ed' to talk about regrets or undesirable situations in the past.,"You should have been there with me, I had a great time. (Chile
I opened the envelope and read the letter. He had written that he was sorry and that he should not have done it. (French, B1 THRESHOLD, Pass, 2008)"

589,MODALITY,should,B1,N/A,USE: THANKING,Can use 'you shouldn’t have' (+ '-ed') in polite acceptance of a gift.,"Thank you for the present you sent me, you shouldn't have! (===NONE===, B1 THRESHOLD, Pass, 2003)

590,MODALITY,should,B2,N/A,FORM: ELLIPSIS,Can use 'should' and 'shouldn't' without a following verb where the previous main verb is understood.,"Well, have you ever checked your blood pressure? I think you should. (Italy

593,MODALITY,should,B2,N/A,USE: OBLIGATION,Can use 'should be' + '-ing' to talk about present general obligation.,Wild animals should be running free but I think that zoos today have an important role in keeping them alive. (Sweden

600,MODALITY,used to,C1,N/A,FORM: QUESTIONS,Can use the question form.,[talking about a change in eating habits] What did we use to eat? (Netherlands

601,MODALITY,used to,C2,N/A,"FORM/USE: WITH 'AS' + PRONOUN, NARRATIVE ","Can use 'as' + pronoun + 'used to' … to add background to a narrative, often to highlight something unusual. ","She had gone out for a walk in the woods as she used to do every Sunday, with her diary in her hand and a pen in her pocket. (Italy

(Mexico

629,MODALITY,would,B1,1,FORM: WITH ADVERBS,"Can use an limited range of adverbs with 'would', including 'really', 'probably', 'certainly', 'definitely'.► adverbs","I hope you will come soon, and I think that you would really enjoy it because is something different of what you are used to. (Peru

632,MODALITY,would,B1,N/A,USE: INDIRECTNESS,"Can use 'would' with verbs such as 'advise', 'imagine', 'recommend', 'say' to be less direct.","I'd advise you to go with your friends because I bet you'll have so much fun! (German, B1 THRESHOLD, Pass, 2008)

633,MODALITY,would,B1,N/A,USE: POLITE REQUESTS,"Can use 'would' to make polite requests, often in the fixed expression 'would you mind'.","Would you tell me about your room in your next letter, please? (Chinese, B1 THRESHOLD, Pass, 2001)

764,PAST,past perfect simple,B1,N/A,FORM/USE: AFTER 'IF' CLAUSES,"Can use the past perfect simple in 'if'-clauses to talk about imagined situations in the past, often with regret. ► 'if'-clauses","If the weather had been better, we would have enjoyed it more. (Argentina
If you had gone there with me, you would have been happy. (Korea, South
So I decided to go back and look for them in the park: believe it or not I would have spent all night in the park, if it hadn't been closed since six o'clock! (Italian
765,PAST,past perfect simple,B1,N/A,FORM: AFFIRMATIVE,Can use the affirmative form.,"I felt really sorry for you after I had read your last letter. (Poland
[?] I'd forgotten that I have an appointment with the doctor [?] (Spanish - Latin American
766,PAST,past perfect simple,B1,N/A,FORM: NEGATIVE,Can use negative forms.,"The ABC Company called this morning to say that our company had not delivered the goods on time. (China
I hadn't heard from her for two months. (Spain

767,PAST,past perfect simple,B1,1,FORM: WITH ADVERBS,Can use the past perfect simple with a limited range of adverbs (including 'never', 'ever', 'just', 'always', 'already') in the normal mid-position. ► adverbs","It was the most beautiful one I had ever seen. (Italy
So, she came to America to see a relation she had never seen before, and she spent the money with me. (Spanish - Latin American
I had just arrived from school when I saw the letter. (Portugal
I had always wanted to visit European cities and Paris was one of the easiest cities to get to from England. (Korea, South
768,PAST,past perfect simple,B1,N/A,USE: TIME UP TO THEN,Can use the past perfect simple to talk about a time before another time in the past.,"He then thought how stupid he had been. (Peru
Actually I'd arranged an appointment with my doctor before calling you. (B1

769,PAST,past perfect simple,B2,N/A,"FORM/USE: AFTER 'BECAUSE', EXPLANATIONS ",Can use the past perfect simple after 'because' to give explanatory information.,"He was sleeping but I realised that this was because he had lost a lot of blood. (Greece
I was driving on to my parents' house because I had arranged to have dinner with them. (Portuguese

770,PAST,past perfect simple,B2,N/A,"FORM/USE: AFTER 'IF ONLY' AND 'WISH', IMAGINED PAST","Can use the affirmative form after 'if only', and the affirmative and negative forms after 'wish' to talk about regret.","If only I had listened to my father! (Iran
If only I had met her before. (Spain
I am sure, because at the end of the concert, I said to my friend ""I wish they had played a bit more"". (Turkey
I wish I hadn't told Pat about my plans. (Poland
I wish I hadn't done that but now I can't do anything. (Greece

771,PAST,past perfect simple,B2,N/A,FORM/USE: INVERSION WITH 'NEVER (BEFORE)',"Can invert the subject and auxiliary verb after 'never (before)' to talk about a unique event, often in formal contexts.","Never had I been in such a ridiculous situation! (South Africa
Never before had we seen such marvellous species of fish. (Poland

772,PAST,past perfect simple,B2,N/A,FORM/USE: INVERSION WITH 'NO SOONER ... THAN',"Can invert the subject and auxiliary verb with 'no sooner ... than' to talk about something that happened immediately before something else, often in formal contexts.","...but no sooner had I gone to bed than someone broke the door down. (Spain
But, no sooner had I got there than my classmates informed me that I had done well in my physics exam. (Greek

773,PAST,past perfect simple,B2,N/A,FORM: ELLIPSIS,Can leave out the subject before the past perfect simple where it is understood from the previous clause.,"But now she felt stronger and had lost her fear. (France
Simon was a very famous writer and had written ten best-sellers. (Greek
All her friends from Chicago had come to visit her and had brought a huge chocolate cake with them. (Spain
They were cold and had gone numb. (Korea, South
774,PAST,past perfect simple,B2,N/A,FORM: QUESTIONS,Can use question forms.,"Had I made the same mistake twice? (B2
? the question was: Why had he done that? (Spain

775,PAST,past perfect simple,B2,3,FORM: WITH ADVERBS,"Can use the past perfect simple with a wide range of adverbs (including 'finally', 'recently', 'simply') in the normal mid-position.  ► adverbs","He had finally achieved his goal! (Greece
She had suddenly woken up at that noise, but now was trying to persuade herself it was just a dream. (Italy
And had all the furniture and David's personal things been stolen by thieves or had they just simply disappeared? (Greece

776,PAST,past perfect simple,B2,N/A,"USE: BACKGROUND INFORMATION, RELATIVE CLAUSE",Can use the past perfect simple in relative clauses to give background information.    ► relative clauses,"After a while Mr and Mrs Landsbury, the couple who had organised the party, got everybody's attention and [?] asked everybody to stay calm. (Italy
He went to the hotel because he wanted to find out who the person was that had sent him a mysterious letter? (First Certificate in English
[?] it was Annika who had arranged a huge party for her, and all her friends and family, at the airport. (Danish, Denmark

777,PAST,past perfect simple,B2,N/A,USE: CHANGE OF SITUATION,Can use the past perfect simple to talk about situations which changed.,"After the show we had planned to go to the theatre restaurant. But it was closed. (France
We had planned to go to Switzerland, but unfortunately our car broke down. (Sweden
At first she had wanted to make the first move but she wasn't quite convinced. (Poland

778,PAST,past perfect simple,B2,N/A,USE: REPORTS OF QUESTIONS,"Can use the past perfect simple to report questions, where the main verb in the reporting clause is in the past simple.  ► reported speech","I asked him who had given him my phone number and he said it had been me. (Poland
He didn't find her, in spite of looking for her in every room of her house, so he decided to come to my house to ask me if I had seen her somewhere. (B2
I asked her what had happened and she told me that my grandmother was very ill. (Greece

779,PAST,past perfect simple,B2,N/A,USE: REPORTS OF STATEMENTS,"Can use the past perfect simple to report statements, where the main verb in the reporting clause is in the past simple.  ► reported speech","[?] one morning she was listening to the radio, when suddenly the announcer said that the police had arrested a man who had stolen five expensive and unique paintings. (Greece
She tried to explain what had happened, but she couldn't. (Spain
I looked at the address and I knew what had happened to my sister's postcard. (Hungary

780,PAST,past perfect simple,C1,N/A,"FORM/USE: INVERSION, IMAGINED PAST","Can invert the subject and affirmative auxiliary verb to talk about imagined situations in the past, often with regret, in formal contexts. ","Had I known the tour would be so bad, I wouldn't have booked it. (France
Had they been new people, travellers from other countries, I could have taken it, but all the customers were English! (Portugal
Sometimes I think that had I gone to Britain without this experience, my life would have been different. (Czech Republic

781,PAST,past perfect simple,C2,N/A,"FORM/USE: AFTER 'IF ONLY', IMAGINED PAST",Can use the negative form after 'if only' to express regret.,"If only she had not changed, if only I had helped her, maybe we would still be best friends and I would not be sitting here, writing about her! (Portugal
If only I hadn't been that rude! (Greece

782,PAST,past perfect simple,C2,N/A,"FORM: FIXED EXPRESSIONS 'HAD IT NOT BEEN FOR', 'IF IT HADN'T BEEN FOR'",Can use 'had it not been for' and 'if it hadn't been for' with a modal form for giving reasons.,"Had it not been for the fact that I had already read the article, I would have thought that this woman was at least thirty years old. (Greece
Another aspect of his emotional side is the fact that he is a very private person, and had it not been for this feature, he might have been able to react differently. (Denmark
If it hadn't been for my lack of knowledge, skills, experience, and some other things like that, I wouldn't have been fired. (Israel
They had become very good friends and their friendship could have gone a little further if it hadn't been for Dan's character. (Argentina

783,PAST,past perfect simple,C2,N/A,FORM: INVERSION WITH 'HARDLY ... WHEN',"Can invert the subject and affirmative auxiliary verb with 'hardly ... when' to talk about something that happened immediately before something else, in formal contexts.","Hardly had she spoken these words when it dawned on the musician that life could not continue like that. (Spain
Hardly had he taken them from the counter when the monster vanished again. (Spain
784,PAST,past simple,A1,1,FORM: AFFIRMATIVE,Can use the affirmative form with a limited range of regular and irregular verbs.,"Every day at college I went to class at 9 am. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH

My grandmother lived in a village and I often went there. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH

I liked this place very much. (A1, French)"

[talking about a lost phone] Did you find it? (Albania
And when did you go shopping last? (Russia
789,PAST,past simple,A2,N/A,FORM: WITH 'WHEN',Can use 'when' + past simple in subordinate clauses.,"When I arrived, the weather was horrible. (Argentina
[talking about a missing phone] I think I left it in the kitchen when I fell on the slippery floor. (Mexico
790,PAST,past simple,B1,3,FORM: AFFIRMATIVE,Can use the affirmative form with a wide range of verbs.,"I convinced some of my friends to come with me even if they don't like rap music. (Italy

The cameraman filmed us during a lesson and later, walking to the playground. (Spain

792,PAST,past simple,B1,1,FORM: QUESTIONS,"Can use 'yes/no', 'wh-', tag and negative question forms with a limited range of verbs.","Did you receive my present? (B1 THRESHOLD

794,PAST,past simple,B1,N/A,USE: IMAGINED SITUATIONS AFTER 'IF',Can use the past simple after 'if' to talk about the possible result of an imagined situation in the present or future.,"It would be better if you spent some time in the fresh air with your friends or walking in a park. (B1, Russian)
If you wanted to do some outdoor activities, we could go fishing or even walking through the green fields.(B1, Arabic ? Egyptian)"

795,PAST,past simple,B1,N/A,USE: ORDERING OF PAST EVENTS,"Can use the past simple to order sequences of events in the past, in the context of narratives.","I remember her as a shy girl, but I read she became a manager, she went on lots of trips, she met a lot of new friends, she got married and then she got divorced. (Italy
We met at 9 in the morning and decided to go to the seven lakes, a very wonderful place not far from the centre of the town: lots of trees, lots of flowers and very fresh air. (B1, Italian)
We waited for the suitcase for two days and then we bought new dresses. (B1, Czech)"
796,PAST,past simple,B1,N/A,USE: REGRET,Can use the past simple with 'wish (that)' to express regret that things are not different.,"I wish that you were here, cycling with us. (B1, Portuguese)
I wish you were here with me. I wish we were together. (B1, French)
I wish weekends lasted five days. (B1, Polish)"
797,PAST,past simple,B2,1,FORM: NEGATIVE,Can use the negative form with a wide range of regular and irregular verbs.,"I didn't hesitate and went there straight away. (Poland
I'm sure it wasn't my fault as I didn't switch anything on or off at that moment. (France
? we really enjoyed our holiday even though things did not turn out they way we planned. (Sweden

798,PAST,past simple,B2,2,FORM: QUESTIONS,"Can use 'yes/no', 'wh-', tag and negative question forms with an increasing range of verbs.","Are you still looking for a job or did you succeed in finding one? (France

799,PAST,past simple,B2,N/A,FORM: WITH SUBORDINATING CONJUNCTIONS,Can use the past simple with a range of subordinating conjunctions, including 'as soon as', 'before', 'if', 'once', 'since', 'so', 'until', 'when', 'while'."," ? as soon as we went down to around 15 metres in depth, we saw a lot of coloured fish. (B2, French)
I told you about that terrible hotel I had stayed in before I came to visit you. (B2, German)
Once he got inside, he started searching for some clues to that horrible crime. (B2, Italian)"

800,PAST,past simple,B2,N/A,FORM: WITH TIME ADJUNCTS,Can use a range of time adjuncts with the past simple.,"I also worked as a helper on a summer camp for primary schoolchildren in Canada last summer. (B2, Japanese)
I can remember one which happened to me last year, during the Christmas holiday. (B2, Italian)

801,PAST,past simple,B2,N/A,USE: POLITENESS AFTER 'IF',"Can use the past simple after 'if' as a politeness structure, especially in letters and emails.","I think it would be very helpful if I told you my own case. (B2, Spanish ? European)
It would be great if you sent me a free copy of the next edition of The Student Tourist Guidebook. (B2, Korean)
I would be grateful if you gave me this job. (B2, Greek)"

802,PAST,past simple,B2,N/A,USE: POLITENESS: 'I WONDERED' AND 'I WANTED',"Can use the past simple with 'I wondered' and 'I wanted' as politeness structures, when making polite requests and thanking.","So, I wondered if you could introduce me to somebody who knows how to use a camera, so that I will be able to record my trip for you. (B2, Greek)
I wanted to know if the rooms are single or double, if they have showers and if there is room service. ? Secondly, I also wanted to know if there is a gym in the hotel ?  (B2, Spanish - European)
First of all, I wanted to thank you for giving me the first prize in your competition. (B2, Spanish ? Latin American)"

803,PAST,past simple,C1,N/A,FORM: INVERSION WITH 'NOT ONLY ... BUT ALSO',"Can use the inverted form of the past simple with auxiliary 'do', in the phrase 'not only ... but also'.","The companies I found at the trade fair were very varied. Not only did I find high-technology companies, but also shoemakers, advertisement companies and plane manufacturers to name but a few. (United Kingdom
Not only didn't we travel 5000 miles in 30 days, as you had advertised, but also we stayed 8 days in just one place, which had nothing interesting to see except a church. (Portugal
Not only didn't I learn any new grammar but also I couldn't enrich my vocabulary. (Switzerland

804,PAST,past simple,C1,3,FORM: QUESTIONS,"Can use 'yes/no', 'wh-', tag and negative question forms with a wide range of verbs.  ► Questions","Did you spot the fact that what is expected from us in Tall Trees Campsite is to help in organising the entertainment? (Sri Lanka

I told you about Peter and Mary, didn't I? (Serbian, C1)
Didn't we all dream of being famous once in our lives? (Germany

805,PAST,past simple,C1,N/A,USE: COMPLEX ORDERING OF PAST EVENTS,Can use the past simple to order sequences of events in the past in a complex way.,Following advice from a friend, I purchased the English version of your product, only to find out its quality did not match the promises made in your advertisement. (C1, Spanish - European)
After having discussed this subject with the other member, we came up with the following decisions. First of all ?  (C1, Greek)"

806,PAST,past simple,C1,N/A,"USE: FOR EMPHASIS, WITH 'DID'",Can use the past simple with 'did' for emphasis.,"We did reach the target figure and we have sent about 85 percent of the money to the hospital. (C1, Portuguese)
[in a letter defending the organisation of an event] We did have 34 games and one stall with beverages and snacks. (C1, Chinese)
It is true that it did rain during the day but it was not a ""sudden downpour"",  as you wrote. It was more a small shower ?  (C1, Swedish) "

807,PAST,past simple,C1,N/A,USE: POLITENESS: 'I THOUGHT',Can use the past simple 'I thought' as a politeness structure to sound less direct.,"I understand you are quite concerned about the matter and I thought it would be a good idea to let you know what is really going on. (C1, Spanish ? Latin American)
The reason why I'm writing to you is that I thought you might be interested in writing about a special dish from your country for the international cookbook. (C1, Czech)"
808,PAST,present perfect continuous,B1,N/A,FORM: AFFIRMATIVE,Can use the affirmative form.,"I have been thinking about your letter. (Spain

[talking about musical instruments] ? how long have you been playing them? (Bangladesh

810,PAST,present perfect continuous,B1,N/A,USE: REPEATED CONTINUING EVENTS,Can use the present perfect continuous to talk about repeated activities which began in the past and are still continuing.,"I've been watching TV a lot, specially the sports programmes. (Brazil
I have been playing my new game. (Turkey

column2: he told me he had joined a sport club and he has been going there for two weeks

column1: 811,PAST,present perfect continuous,B1,N/A,USE: SINGLE CONTINUING EVENT,"Can use the present perfect continuous to talk about a single activity or state that began in the past and is still continuing, often with 'for' or 'since'. ","I've been studying International business there for four years. (Algeria
I've been living here since last April and it seemed no problem during spring and summer. (Japan
Susan has been working in our company for 6 years as a Sales Representative. (Hong Kong
812,PAST,present perfect continuous,B2,1,FORM: NEGATIVE,Can use the negative form.,"I hope that I have not been wasting your time and giving you too much trouble. (Malaysia
Hope you haven't been working too hard! (Japan
The heating system has not been working properly since your staff completed the work in my house. (Turkey

813,PAST,present perfect continuous,B2,2,FORM: WITH ADVERBS,Can use the present perfect continuous with adverbs in the normal mid position.,"I have just been reading an article in your newspaper this morning, about The Westfield Music Festival. (Sweden
I've also been singing in a choir for five years, so I'm very familiar with it. (Sweden
You have already been complaining about headaches and insomia. (Poland

814,PAST,present perfect continuous,B2,N/A,USE: RECENT PAST,Can use the present perfect continuous to focus on a finished activity in the recent past but where the effects or results are still important or relevant.,They might be slippery when it has been snowing. (Sweden

815,PAST,present perfect continuous,C2,N/A,FORM/USE: INVERSION,Can invert the subject and affirmative auxiliary verb with 'not only ... but' as a focusing device. ► focus ► inversion,"Not only have I been wandering its streets ever since I was ten, but I have also come to know most of the main characters of its history in the past 50 years. (Spain
Not only have I been expecting it for the last few months but I will also give some support to my wife, who has been feeling a little nervous these last weeks. (Portugal

816,PAST,present perfect simple,A2,N/A,FORM/USE: TIME WITH 'FOR',Can use the negative form with 'for' to talk about a past event or action which hasn't occurred again in the period of time up to now.,"I haven't eaten Italian food for a long time. (Ecuador
I'm sorry I haven't written for so long. (Greece
I haven't seen you for ages. (Russia

817,PAST,present perfect simple,A2,N/A,FORM/USE: WITH 'YET',Can use the negative form with 'yet' to talk about events which are expected to be completed at some point in the future.,"[talking about a new mobile phone] I haven't seen it yet . (Cyprus
[talking about a book] It's very important because I haven't finished it yet. (Nepal
I haven't seen this film yet. (Estonia

818,PAST,present perfect simple,A2,1,FORM: AFFIRMATIVE,"Can use the affirmative form 'have' + '-ed' with pronouns 'I' and 'we', and with a limited range of verbs.","I have seen the Eiffel Tower and many old buildings. (Turkey
I like Japanese people and I've been to Japan more than three times. (China
We have seen the Tower of London, Big Ben, the Houses of the Parliament and of course Buckingham Palace. (France
819,PAST,present perfect simple,A2,1,FORM: NEGATIVE,Can use the negative form 'haven't' + '-ed' with 'I' with a limited range of verbs.,"I haven't eaten Italian food for a long time. (Ecuador
I haven't seen you for a long time. (A2 WAYSTAGE
820,PAST,present perfect simple,A2,1,FORM: QUESTIONS,Can use the question form 'have you' + '-ed' with with a limited range of verbs.,"Have you bought anything? (Italy
Hi Jools, How have you been? (Japan
Where have you been? (Ecuador

821,PAST,present perfect simple,A2,1,FORM: WITH ADVERBS,Can use the present perfect simple with a limited range of adverbs in the normal mid position.,I have never seen a competition like that before, and I love it. (Brazil

822,PAST,present perfect simple,A2,N/A,USE: EXPERIENCES,Can use the present perfect simple to talk about experiences up to now.,"I've seen the British Museum. (Taiwan

824,PAST,present perfect simple,B1,N/A,FORM/USE: WITH 'ALREADY',"Can use the present perfect simple with 'already' to emphasise that something is done, often before the expected time.  ► adverbs","I've already planned the party, bought his present, and most important of all, I 've already told everyone. (Mexico

825,PAST,present perfect simple,B1,2,FORM: AFFIRMATIVE,Can use the affirmative forms with a range of pronouns and nouns and an increasing range of verbs.,"I've left some clothes at the dry cleaner's 100 yards from my home, in Park Street. (B1 THRESHOLD

829,PAST,present perfect simple,B1,N/A,USE: RECENT PAST,"Can use the present perfect simple to refer to a finished event or state in the recent past, that has a present relevance, often with 'just'.  ► adverbs","My mother has broken her right leg. (Peru

830,PAST,present perfect simple,B1,N/A,USE: UNFINISHED,Can use the present perfect simple to refer to a state or period of time which is unlimited or indefinite.,"In spite of bad weather forecasts on TV, it has been a sunny, warm weekend. (Spain

831,PAST,present perfect simple,B1,N/A,USE: WITH SUPERLATIVE,Can use the present perfect simple with a superlative adjective to talk about a unique experience.  ► adjectives: superlatives,"This restaurant has the most delicious shrimps I have ever tasted. (Mexico

832,PAST,present perfect simple,B2,N/A,FORM/USE: WITH 'STILL',Can use the negative form of the present perfect simple with 'still' to emphasise that something that was expected to happen continues not to happen.  ► adverbs,"I still haven't read the role but when I read it, I was very excited and I accepted Mr Brown's offer. (Greece

835,PAST,present perfect simple,C2,N/A,USE: NEWSWORTHY,Can use the present perfect simple to introduce news.,A new shopping centre has opened in our town. (Russia

1107,CLAUSES,conditional,A2,N/A,"FORM/USE: PRESENT SIMPLE 'IF' CLAUSE, REAL CONDITIONS","Can use 'if' + present simple with present simple, 'can' or imperative in the main clause to refer to things that are true now or very likely to happen. ","If I have spare time I always read a book. (Turkey

1108,CLAUSES,conditional,A2,N/A,"USE: 'IF' CLAUSE + IMPERATIVE, HEDGING","Can use an 'if-' clause ('if you want', 'like', 'prefer') to soften the directness of imperatives, offers or suggestions.","Bring some films if you want. (Spain

1109,CLAUSES,conditional,B1,N/A,"FORM/USE: PRESENT SIMPLE 'IF' CLAUSE + 'WILL', FUTURE, LIKELY OUTCOME (FIRST CONDITIONAL)","Can use 'if' + present simple to introduce a possible future condition, with 'will' in the main clause to talk about a likely result. ","I talked to my parents and I think if you tell them your reasons, they will accept it. (Germany

1112,CLAUSES,conditional,B1,N/A,"FORM/USE: 'IF' + PAST SIMPLE + 'WOULD', FUTURE, IMAGINED SITUATION (SECOND CONDITIONAL)","Can form conditional subordinate clauses with 'if' + past simple, and would in the main clause, to talk about an imagined situation, often in the context of advice or opinion-giving. ","Maybe it would be more fun if you went with your friends. (Portugal

1114,CLAUSES,conditional,B1,N/A,"FORM/USE: 'UNLESS', EXCEPTIONS","Can use 'unless' + present simple to talk about an exception, with present and future reference.","I think I am going to pay by cash, unless you accept credit cards. (B1 THRESHOLD

1167,FOCUS,focus,C1,N/A,FORM/USE: 'WHAT' CLEFT CLAUSE,"Can use 'What' + noun or pronoun + verb phrase as subject + 'be', for focus.  ","What we need is a strong publicity campaign, directed at young people. (Portugal
